channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Wikipedia inks new deals with AI companies to mark 25th anniversary
item.description: Wikipedia unveiled new business deals with a slew of artificial intelligence companies on Thursday as it marked its 25th anniversary. The online crowd...

item.title: Verizon is giving customers a $20 credit for the outage—but only if they claim it. Here’s how
item.description: If you are Verizon customer, like me, you’ve probably been scrambling to make phone calls, send texts, and get online since Wednesday, due to a massiv...

item.title: ‘They’re going to have to think and act a lot more like hotels’: The new rules of office space now that the ‘genie is out of the bottle on hybrid’
item.description: From cold plunges to nap pods to meditation rooms, many employers are turning to luxury to lure in their workers.

item.title: Exclusive: Former OpenAI policy chief creates nonprofit institute, calls for independent safety audits of frontier AI models
item.description: Former OpenAI policy head Miles Brundage debuts AVERI, an institute advocating for independent safety audits of top AI models

item.title: Worried about AI taking your job? New Anthropic research shows it’s not that simple
item.description: Anthropic’s latest data suggests AI won’t wipe out work overnight—but it will redraw the map of who wins, who struggles, and how jobs actually change.

item.title: Customers lament Tesla’s move toward monthly fees for self-driving cars: ‘You will own nothing and be happy’
item.description: Elon Musk announced Tesla would no longer allow outright purchases of self-driving software, and users aren't happy.

item.title: Why Washington’s healthcare debate never really goes away
item.description: The president was barely a year into his administration when a health care debate began to consume Washington. On Capitol Hill, partisan divides forme...

item.title: Google Says It Fixed a Bluetooth Flaw. Researchers Claim Hackers Can Still Track You
item.description: Google’s Fast Pair allows users to easily connect Bluetooth devices, but it could also let hackers to do the same if your software isn’t up to date.

item.title: This TikTok lifehack could help you embrace rejection
item.description: Rejection stings. If you’re on the job hunt right now, it’s likely something you’ve grown accustomed to, if not entirely numb to. Considering more tha...

item.title: Who Is Apple’s Creator Studio Really For?
item.description: Too complex for the Canva crowd and too lightweight for Adobe users, Apple’s Creator Studio subscription straddles a challenging middle ground.

item.title: This Mistake Will Make Kevin O’Leary Toss Your Resume
item.description: It’s the ‘Shark Tank’ investor’s hiring red flag.

item.title: BlackRock CEO Says Your 401(k) Could Get a Major Upgrade This Year
item.description: The giant asset manager announced plans for a new target-date 401(k) that taps into private markets.

item.title: Oracle struggles to attract workers to Nashville ‘world HQ’—even with a 2-million-square-foot office and Larry Ellison’s favorite restaurant
item.description: Years after cofounder Larry Ellison declared Nashville its world headquarters, Oracle has added only a handful of workers.

item.title: Some scientists say research on microplastics is flawed: What does it mean for our bodies?
item.description: In recent years, there’s been a wave of studies reporting that humans are basically full of microplastics: They’ve been found in our brains , arteries...

item.title: Elon Musk Predicts This Airline Will ‘Lose Customers’ in Latest Feud
item.description: The SpaceX CEO disapproves of the airline’s recent declaration.
